result.execSummary:
The defendant Malinda S Menefee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:36 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Malinda S Menefee in court.  Attorney Robert A. Gardner in court for Malinda S Menefee. 
Court questions the defendant regarding in-person appearance.  Defendant waives their in-person appearance today & will proceed by zoom. 

Atty Burdon states plea agreement to Count 2.  Count 1 to be dismissed and read-in.  Defendant agrees.

Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea. 
 Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Count 2 and orders the judgment of conviction as of today's date. 
Count 1 to be dismissed and read-in.

Atty Burdon makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Gardner makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Count 2:  Court orders 10 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence 
Report on or before September 9, 2022 by 7:00pm, clean & sober. 
Court Costs = $243.00
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00
Drug Surcharge = $10.00
Credit = 3 days
Good Time
60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with the COC office 

Count 1 to be dismissed and read-in.

Atty Gardner and the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.  Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 

BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

3:41 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Malinda S Menefee in court.  Attorney Robert A. Gardner in court for Malinda S Menefee. 
Court notes that this was set for a plea/sentencing but today there is a waiver of Prelim form filed.  Atty Gardner states that he would like the State to consider their counter offer still and requests a reset on that matter.
Atty Gardner states that the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Burdon files the information electronically with the Court.
Status hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status hearing on July 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:21 PM Defendant Malinda S Menefee appeared by phone.  Attorney Robert A. Gardner appeared by phone for Malinda S Menefee.  Attorney Cliff Burdon appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Gardner states that a counter offer was given to the State but he has not heard anything yet; requests a Plea hearing in 30 days.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Plea
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 24, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status hearing on April 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:36 AM Defendant Malinda S Menefee appeared by phone means.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Attorney Robert A. Gardner appeared by video means for Defendant Malinda S Menefee.
  Atty Gardner states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Gardner states that the defendant waives time limits for the Prelim.    Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands.
  Court confirms address and phone.  Defendant agrees with the waiver of time limits.

BY THE COURT:    Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing.
  Status hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Payable Number: 73920,
Receipt Number: 22R 000829,
Amount: $20.00
Initial appearance on March 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription

03:34 PM Defendant Malinda S Menefee appeared by video means from Marquette County Jail. Prosecuting Atty Clifford C. Burdon appeared for State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.    Court confirms address and phone.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and is getting an Attorney.

  Atty Juech has no objection to a $1,000 signature bond with conditions.
  Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes.
 
BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $1,000 Signature bond with conditions:
  *No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription  Initial appearance scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
